meanings.definition: Chalutzim: plural form of chalutz, meaning a pioneer or settler in Israel.
meanings.sent1: The chalutzim worked hard to build new homes in the land.
meanings.sent2: Many chalutzim moved to Israel to start a new life.
meanings.sent3: The chalutzim decided to have a race to see who could build the fastest.
meanings.sent4: Their determination made the chalutzim like unstoppable forces of nature.
meanings.sent5: In the history books, the chalutzim were described as brave and adventurous souls.

meanings.definition: Chalutzim: members of a Zionist youth movement focused on agricultural work in Israel.
meanings.sent1: Every summer, the chalutzim would gather to plant crops in the fields.
meanings.sent2: The chalutzim organization aimed to teach young people about farming.
meanings.sent3: During the meeting, the chalutzim accidentally spilled water all over the floor.
meanings.sent4: Their unity made the chalutzim a strong and resilient community.
meanings.sent5: The chalutzim's passion for agriculture was contagious among the youth.
